poem:
"Sanctuary Denied"

In our well-ordered homes, we pour over denial,
Printing rejection on Pearl River whispers.
The shadow-leaders, silenced, seek invisibility,
In the iron curve of our demands, absurdity echoes.

Details misaligned, names perverted,
We craft a maze of papers for lost souls.
While the silent dragon prowls the waning moon,
Its hungry breath seeping through our callous walls.
